Based on an HTTP-server. Supports Estonian and fast/accurate recognition. Based on a WebSocket-server. Demos Demo apps that show different ways of using speech input Auto start Start recording automatically Auto stop after pause Stop recording after a longer pause Max recording time Stop recording after %1$s seconds Partial results Show partial results in the editor window Support device language Assume that the input speech is in the device\'s default language, unless the app sets a different language Sample rate Sampling %1$s times per second Audio format %1$s\n(Using a non-raw format results in 2x less network traffic. Requires at least Android v4.1 or even v5.0, and might not work on all devices.) Return errors Return network/audio/etc. errors to the caller (useful if the caller does error handling) Help text Show usage instructions by the microphone button. Makes the speech keyboard larger. Updating… Enable speech keyboard The Kõnele speech keyboard allows you to dictate into any text field in any app. Tap here to enable it in the Android keyboard and input method settings. List of apps where you have used speech input List of grammars that translate the raw transcription into app-specific language Demonstrates the simplest way of using the speech recognizer Shows only the "result extras" returned by the recognizer Repeatedly calls the speech recognizer and shows the best transcription. Grammar can be assigned to the input (via menu). Chat-style UI for calling intents Forwards the results to a search app Various demos/tests related to audio recording and encoding HTML form with various types of fields for testing the IME Recognition languages & services Languages & services All recognition services System-wide settings of all the installed speech recognition services, as well as the Assist-app. Rewrites List of available rewrite rule tables that can be used to rewrite the transcription. At most one table can be active at a time. Quick settings Quickly apply some common default settings Recognition hypotheses Output only the most likely recognition hypothesis Output at most %d recognition hypotheses Tap & Speak Tap & Speak Speak now! Tap when finished Speak now! Pause when finished Yes No OK Go to settings Cancel Transcribing… Still transcribing…

%1$s is an app that offers speech-to-text services to other apps. Many apps contain a text area or a text field (e.g. a search bar) that can be edited using the keyboard. %1$s provides a speech keyboard, which allows speech to be converted to text. Many apps (e.g. intelligent assistants, keyboard apps, navigation apps) also contain a microphone button that is either linked to the standard Android speech recognition activity or the standard Android speech recognition service. %1$s implements both the activity and the service.

How to use the speech keyboard? Tap the big yellow button and start dictating, the words appear immediately in the text area. Swipe left to delete the previous word, swipe right to add a newline, double-tap to add space, long-press to select all text (e.g. to dictate over it). Using the voice search activity is similar but the swipe operations are missing because the transcription is immediately returned to the calling app.

Kõnele contains two transcription services that use two cloud-based speech recognition servers. One supports grammar-based speech recognition, the other supports continuous full-duplex speech recognition. Both servers focus on Estonian speech recognition, but both are based on a fully open-source stack that makes them easy to deploy and customize for other languages. For more information, see http://phon.ioc.ee. In principle any recognition language and service available on the device can be used on %1$s\'s keyboard and voice search panel, however, only %1$s\'s own services have been tested.

How to use grammar-based speech recognition? Use the \"Apps & Grammars\" settings to assign grammars to individual apps in order to improve the recognition quality and map the recognized speech automatically to the expected application format. %1$s is preloaded with links to several speech grammars for Estonian and English, covering domains like unit conversion, address queries, setting the alarm clock. More grammars are available at http://kaljurand.github.io/Grammars/.

Documentation, source code, and the list of requested features and known issues are available at the %1$s website.

No apps yet. This list will be automatically populated with the apps where you have used speech input. No grammars. Add a new grammar via the Add-menu. No servers. Add a new server via the Add-menu. No rewrite rule tables. Add a table via the Add-menu or by exporting it from a spreadsheet app as a TSV-file. No rewrite rules were found. Make sure the input file is in the correct format, i.e. the columns are tab-separated and the first line is a header.
